intro: Lagansa alba, commonly known as white lagansa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic species. The plant is characterized by its large, white spadix surrounded by a showy, green spathe. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in humid and tropical climates. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological studies and ornamental horticulture.
